scut noun [C]
(TAIL)
Add to word list
Add to word list
the tail of a deer, rabbit, or hare: The rabbit’s white scut disappeared into the tall weeds.
More examplesFewer examplesThe buck snorted, flashed a white scut, and leaped away.The hare galloped away, his white scut bobbing.He was just in time to see the naked figure run into another room, the buttocks white as a rabbit's scut.

scut noun [C]
(PERSON)
Irish English informal a person who you think is bad, stupid, or unpleasant: Go away, you little scut!
More examplesFewer examplesHow dare you? It's the anniversary of your mother's death, you little scut!She was such a level-headed person; I can't believe she'd be taken in by a scut like him.That young scut has put a girl in the family way.What do you know about it, you ignorant young scut?
